value.title: Secure an ASP.NET Core web app with the Identity framework
value.excerpt: Add authentication and authorization to an ASP.NET Core web app using the Identity framework.

value.title: Spark architecture fundamentals
value.excerpt: Spark architecture fundamentals

value.title: Stage a web app deployment for testing and rollback by using App Service deployment slots
value.excerpt: Discover the benefits of creating deployment slots to streamline deployment and roll back a web app in Azure App Service.

value.title: Train a machine learning model with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Machine Learning to train a model and register it in a workspace.

value.title: Use unsupervised learning to analyze unlabeled data
value.excerpt: Use unsupervised learning methods to predict groupings in data. Use variations of k-means clustering and spectral clustering to analyze and visualize difficult data sets.

images.title: Use unsupervised learning to analyze unlabeled data

value.title: Upload data to Azure Data Lake Storage
value.excerpt: Learn about creating an Azure Data Lake Storage account and uploading data to Data Lake Storage Gen 2 through the Azure Storage Explorer.

value.title: Upload, download, and manage data with Azure Storage Explorer
value.excerpt: Azure Storage Explorer allows you to quickly view all the storage services under your account. You can browse through, read, and edit data stored in those services through a user-friendly graphical interface.

value.title: Upload your project by using GitHub best practices
value.excerpt: Learn to upload your existing project to GitHub.

value.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks

value.title: Work with Data in Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Learn how to work with datastores and datasets in Azure Machine Learning.

value.title: 60 seconds to a Linkerd service mesh on AKS | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: See just how easy it is to deploy a service mesh to your AKS cluster. William Morgan, maintainer of the open source service mesh Linkerd, joins Scott Hanselman to demonstrate just how easy it is to deploy Linkerd. Together they explore how to debug a live microservices application using the service mesh,

value.title: An introduction to decentralized identities | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Danny Strockis joins Scott Hanselman to discuss decentralized identity, which gives users ownership of their digital identities and data by leveraging permissionless distributed ledgers.  04:07 - Authentication concept 10:30 - Demo  Decentralized identity – Own your own identity https://aka.ms/azfr/566/01

value.title: An overview of Azure Blueprints | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Alex Frankel (@sonofdiesel) joins Scott Hanselman (@shanselman) to discuss Azure Blueprints. Environment creation can be a long and error prone process. Azure Blueprints helps you deploy and update cloud environments in a repeatable manner using composable artifacts such as policies, role-based access

value.title: Azure API for FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Michael Hansen joins Scott Hanselman to explain what FHIR is and how to get started with FHIR on Azure. Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (or, FHIR) is a new standard for representing and exchanging healthcare data. Developed by the HL7 community to address problems with interoperability, pieces
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/5vS7Iq9vpXE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure App Service Web Apps | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Byron Tardif joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure App Service Web Apps, the best way to build and host web applications in the programming language of your choice without managing infrastructure. It offers auto-scaling and high availability, supports both Windows and Linux, and enables automated deployments

value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn about the Azure Certifications for developers. value.title: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 overview | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: James Baker joins Lara Rubbelke to introduce Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2, which is redefining cloud storage for big data analytics due to multi-modal (object store and file system) access and combining the best qualities of a dedicated analytics file system with those of a cloud-scale object store.

value.title: Azure Friday | Visually build pipelines for Azure Data Factory V2
value.excerpt: Gaurav Malhotra shows Donovan Brown how you can now visually build pipelines for Azure Data Factory V2 and be more productive by getting pipelines up & running quickly without writing any code.  For more information, see:  ADF v2: Visual Tools enabled in public preview (blog) - https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/adf-v2-visual-tools-enabled-in-public-preview/

value.title: Azure Security Center | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Kelly Anderson joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Security Center, which offers built-in security management and threat protection for your cloud workloads. Azure Security Center helps you find & fix vulnerabilities, aids in blocking malicious access and alerts you when your resources are under attack.

value.title: Bring compute, storage, and intelligence to the edge with Azure Stack Edge | Azure Friday

value.excerpt: Jacob Jedryszek joins Scott Hanselman to talk about about using Cognitive Services with Azure Search with your mobile and web apps.
